Experience Sr. Visual Designer Intel Corporation May 2012  – Present (3 years 4 months) I am part of the Mobile and Communications Group (MCG) which develops smartphones, tablets, 2 in 1 convertible devices, wireless connectivity, and many other products that keeps people connected. 
 
Most recently I am helping Intel reach it's 40 million tablet goal by developing the visual design and user experiences for iconic devices using Intel's RealSense camera technology. Working with a small global team, we have been developing hardware design and software apps on aggressive deadlines. 
 
Intel's RealSense technology has enabled my team to change the mobile photography landscape by creating depth enabled experiences: 
 
• Depth Snapshot (mobile photography in depth layers) 
• Depth Filters (focus/refocus & filters in depth layers) 
• Measurement (measuring tool using depth awareness) 
• Social Gallery (photo gallery with social features) 
• and many more! 
 
Past projects have included: 
• WiDi (wireless display connectivity for phones & tablets) 
• Social Camera & Gallery for iconic mobile phones (with a long list of features) 
• and many more projects! Designer Lumata November 2011  –  May 2012  (7 months) Los Gatos, CA Company spin-off from Buongiorno USA. Same title and duties applied. Summary I'd rather not carve my career into thinking for the 1x, iterative solution. I want to think, plan, execute, and ship for disruptive experience and positive change; standing apart. Give me a real problem – expect a real solution. 
 
Every day presents new challenges within the product design environment. Being tasked with inventing new solutions to old problems that truly matter is why I do what I do. It's an exciting frontier, and while an incredible privilege, ego and all political distraction must be stripped away to focus on the user, and the end game experience.  
 
I have experience in working with engineering within agile environments, and am accustomed to fast pace deliverables. No matter the time-frame, I'm a solid believer of doing right by people, and working my butt off for the common good and overall success of any such design.
